availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel S. Darneal (Woodford County, KY, clerk)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Jacob Darneal and Patsy Darneal. Student in Kanawha County, Virginia, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Kanawha County in 1850. Clerk in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Kanawha County, District 29, p. 141B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Virginia, Kanawha County, District 29, p. 65.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 835.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 532A.
"Samuel S. 'Sam' Darneal (1839-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial 202965854, accessed March 12, 2020, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/202965854.
